oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cul-Car-Mac, the Falls of Fall Creek, near Smithville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Waterfalls; Streams; Cliffs; Lithography; Books
Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The falls of Fall Creek in Dekalb County, Tennessee. There is one man standing at the top of the falls, while two men are at the foot of the falls.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Safford, James M. (James Merrill), 1822-1907
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Cul-Car-Mac Falls are falls located in Dekalb County, Tennessee, latitude-logitude coordinates of N 35.94506 and West 85.7761. The nearest town is Smithville, Tennessee. James M. Safford of Lebanon, Tennessee, was named State Geologist in 1854. As a professor at Cumberland College in Nashville, Safford in the late 1850s published a report of geological conditions in Tennessee, known as "The Geology of Tennessee." He later adapted this book for use as a state textbook.
